nodes.bodyText:
if (schemaRules.isEmpty()) { return true; }
Then you don't need to have schemaRules.isPresent() &&  in all the cases above.
@kokosing - I have made the changes and pushed

I think we need a better way to injecting rules to tests. It would be nice to define them next to the test as java object, then do serialization round trip, and the do the test. Maybe this should go as a refactor before this commit or after.
Then instead of giant test with many cases we could have plenty of smaller test per case.
@kokosing - I get your point. Think we can do it after this commit. Will create a followup ticket to track it.

it it to the very bottom of this file.
Also can you please introduce this method in the commit before and use it for other tests as well?
@kokosing - I have made the changes and pushed
Please define one test per each schema related access control method. One for checkCanDropSchema, one for checkCanRenameSchema etc...
@kokosing - I have made the changes and pushed
please move this method somewhere to the bottom of this class. Favor public interface first and also order methods by usage.
can you use assertj. assertThatThrownBy() and assert error message here?
@kokosing - This is done
can you use assertj assertThatThrownBy()? Please also verify error message (it is quite important to know that the proper exception was raised).
@kokosing - This is done
Please extract such refactorings as separate preparatory commit. It has nothing to do with actual change of adding schema rules to file based access control.
@kokosing I have reverted this changes and will have a separate ticket to refactor those.

DROP_SCHEMA_ERR_MESSAGE -> DROP_SCHEMA_ACCESS_DENIED_MESSAGE
Same for all below.
This is changed.
INVALID_JSON_ERR_MESSAGE -> INVALID_JSON

assertDenied  -> assertAccessDenied
expectedErrMessage -> expectedMessage
This is changed.
check that message equals or matches the pattern
@kokosing - I have changed to hasMessageMatching() and using pattern to match. Let me know if that's ok.
I don't think there is a value in this refactor. Let's leave it as it was.
I have reverted this back.
